abstract: Under pressure from European regulators and others, Microsoft was expected to say it will give customers the ability to use documents in Open Document Format — the main rival to the Microsoft Word format.
snippet: Under pressure from European regulators and others, Microsoft was expected to say it will give customers the ability to use documents in Open Document Format — the main rival to the Microsoft Word format.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft was set to announce Thursday that it would make the interchangeable document format of a competitor available in its own market-leading Office 2007 software during the first half of 2009.

headline.main: Open-Source File Format Is to Be a Part of Microsoft Office
headline.print_headline: Open-Source File Format Is to Be a Part of Microsoft Office

abstract: Microsoft is taking a new approach to jump-starting its search engine: offering rebates to people who use it to find and buy some products.
snippet: Microsoft is taking a new approach to jump-starting its search engine: offering rebates to people who use it to find and buy some products.
lead_paragraph: With its share of the Internet search market in steady decline and its pursuit of an alliance with Yahoo in doubt, Microsoft is taking a new approach to jump-starting its search engine: offering rebates to people who use it to find and buy some products.

headline.main: Microsoft Offers Rebates to Shoppers Using Its Search
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Offers Rebates to Shoppers Using Its Search

abstract: Sun Microsystems‘ acquisition of MySQL gave it a chunk of the huge enterprise database market. The 451 Group takes a look at how Oracle, IBM and Microsoft might respond with more deal activity of their own.
lead_paragraph: Sun Microsystems‘ acquisition of MySQL gave it a chunk of the huge enterprise database market. The 451 Group takes a look at how Oracle, IBM and Microsoft might respond with more deal activity of their own.

headline.main: More Deals for Enterprise Database Companies?

abstract: Microsoft has too much money and not enough customers, so why not pay people to use its services? Sometimes this works, but it may not help Microsoft much in its battle with Google.
snippet: Microsoft has too much money and not enough customers, so why not pay people to use its services? Sometimes this works, but it may not help Microsoft much in its battle with Google.
lead_paragraph: The rap on Microsoft is that it copies everyone else’s good ideas. That may be too kind. I think it also copies a lot of proven bad ideas. To wit, Microsoft’s latest move to offer shopping rebates to people who use its Internet search service.

headline.main: Microsoft Should Know Money Can’t Buy Love
